q: X FACTOR boss Simon Cowell is trying to entice Britain's top voiceover man to America. Booming Peter Dickson, 49, is familiar to millions of fans for telling nervous contestants: It's time... to face... the music! Now Simon Cowell wants him to deliver his sound on the talent show's American version from the autumn. Peter, who also does Britain's Got Talent, Family Fortunes, The Paul O'Grady Show,

Donald Rumsfeld 's paper was given to the White House only two weeks after President Bush had approved a US military operation in Afghanistan directed against Osama bin Laden and the Taliban regime. Staff Writer Friday, January 28, 2011 Rep. Mike Pence ( R-Ind.) will not run for president in 2012 but has left the door open to running for governor of the Hoosier State. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana, Mike Pence said in a letter to supporters first reported Thursday by the Indianapolis Star. He acknowledged Michael Vick 's past but noted that since making some bad choices, Michael Vick has devoted time to speaking to children about staying in school staying away from drugs, making positive choices about picking friends and the importance of education. Andy Coulson one degree of separation to the McCann affair: McCann family spokesman Clarence Mitchell joins CCHQ as head of media monitoring for the election www.prweek.com PR Week has the story: The Conservative Party has signed up Clarence Mitchell , best-known as spokesman for Madeleine McCann's parents, as the head of media monitoring for its general election campaign, PRWeek can exclusively reveal. " Clarence Mitchell joins the Tory comms operation today, reporting directly to director of communications Andy Coulson . Clarence Mitchell , who was the director of the Government's media monitoring unit for two years( 2005-2007) will take a back room role, monitoring the progress of the Tories' campaign in the media. Clarence Mitchell , a former BBC News presenter, is a member of the Conservative Party in north London and also Home Secretary Theresa May says the Government will wait for the outcome of the police phone hacking investigation..
